intro: Senecillis mortonii, commonly known as the Morton's senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features slender, upright stems with narrow, hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense, daisy-like clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
